name: Spicy Broccoli and Tomato with Farro
author: J. Whitcomb
summary: I wanted to make a pasta salad, but didn't feel like going shopping, so I rummaged through my kitchen to see what was available that could be done in less than an hour - difficult for me, since I like to cook from scratch as much as possible! I ate it as a main dish, but it would also make a great side dish. The chile paste recipe came from an online guide to pickled mangoes. The mangoes didn't come out well, so I use the chile paste to add a kick to any of my recipes.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon beef base (such as Better than Bouillon®)
1 cup chopped young broccoli florets and leaves
directions: Combine Thai chiles, salt, sugar, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes in a mortar and pestle
Pound until a paste is formed
Place farro in a pot and cover with water; bring to a boil over medium-high heat
Reduce heat and add beef base
Cook farro, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 30 minutes
Heat sesame oil in a large saucepan over medium heat
Add garlic; cook until browned, 2 to 3 minutes
Stir in broccoli; cook until color brightens, about 3 minutes
Mix in tomatoes, basil, and oregano
Add butter and the chile paste, stirring constantly until melted, about 3 minutes
Remove pan from heat and mix in the cooked farro
